item.title: All RuneScape DragonWilds Weapons (& How to Craft Them)
item.description:
Like in all good survival games with crafting mechanics, RuneScape: Dragonwilds includes a wide variety of weapons for players to craft and unlock. They're broken down into three main categories (Melee, Ranged, and Magic), with each category made up of one or two different types.

Melee weapons can either be one or two-handed, while ranged weapons are made up of short and longbows. As of the time of writing, Battlestaves are the only magic weapons in the game, although this may well change once the full release of RuneScape: Dragonwilds rolls around.

RuneScape: Dragonwilds weapons with a Power Level of 1 or 2 can be crafted at a Crafting Table. Weapons with a Power Level of 3 or 4 will require a Smithing Anvil.

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #678 April 19, 2025
item.description:
Today's Connections challenge requires sorting sixteen words into four secret categories, with no more than three incorrect attempts permitted. The puzzle often appears deceptively simple until you encounter a word that just doesn't seem to fit anywhere.

If you are stuck on this one and already know how to play Connections , you can find everything you need in the article below. There will be clues, spoilers, and even the whole answer to this puzzle if you want to see it.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #678 for April 19, 2025

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Hot, Devil, Golden, Intro Class, Lab, Bully, Sandy, Address, Dry, Cannabis, Lecture, James Bond, Talk, Chow, Vast, and Speech.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

There are several sections below, each with different kinds of help for this innovative puzzle game. This includes general hints, category clues, and spoilers too.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle

Searching for the whole answer to this popular puzzle game? You can find all the parts in the section below, including all the categories and what goes in which one.

item.title: NYTs Strands Hints, Tips, and Answers for Today, April 19, 2025
item.description:
The NYT's Strands puzzle is back with another letter grid that hides more than meets the eye. Unlike regular word searches, you're not just finding random words; you're uncovering mystery words connected by a clever theme while ensuring no letter goes unused.

When that combination proves too tricky and this mobile-friendly puzzle game has you frustrated, this guide offers a helping hand. If you need something more than the single clue that Strands has given you, you can find a whole bunch of clues in the article below.

#412 April 19, 2025: ___ a ___

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue ___ a ___ . It has eight things to find: the Spangram and seven themed words.

NYT Strands Spangram Tips and Theme Hints

In need of help but don't like the in-game hints? In the three sections below, you will find themed hints that won't spoil any words. They are just little nudges in the right direction instead of full-on spoilers for this difficult puzzle game.

General Spangram Hint 1

General Spangram Hint 2

General Spangram Hint 3

Spoilers for Today's New York Times Strands

Need a spoiler for this mind-boggling puzzle game? In the two sections below, you will find a single spoiled word along with a screenshot of where to put that word in the grid. Open them up with the "Read More" button below each one.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to the NYT ___ a ___ Strands

If you need the answer for today's Strands puzzle, you can find it below. Open up the section to see all the themed words and a screenshot of where all those words go in this puzzle game's letter grid.

Today's Strands Explained

If you want more of an explanation for this browser game, look into the expandable section below. It houses a breakdown of what the clue, the theme, and the themed words all have in common and how it all makes sense.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: Genshin Impact Leaks New Exciting Details About Skirk
item.description:
Summary

  • Skirk in Genshin Impact may be a highly anticipated Cryo character with unique talents like Void Rift and Serpent's Subtlety.
  • Skirk's ties to the Abyss and possible mentorship of Tartaglia hint at her significant role in the game's narrative.
  • Fans speculate that Skirk might debut in Genshin Impact Version 5.7, offering exciting new gameplay possibilities.

A new Genshin Impact leak has revealed more intriguing details about a character named Skirk, who is expected to join the roster in an upcoming update. Since Skirk's official appearance back in Genshin Impact Version 4.2, Skirk has quickly become one of the most anticipated characters in the game.

Whenever a major region is introduced, players are usually most excited about the release of two specific character types: an Archon, who typically takes the spotlight, and a Harbinger, who often serves as the main villain. So far, the current Natlan storyline has hinted that Capitano, the primary Harbinger antagonist of the Pyro nation, wont be joining the playable roster anytime soon. This has led many fans to believe that HoYoverse will likely add another popular character in his place, and Skirk seems to be a prime candidate.

A credible Genshin Impact leaker named Dim has shared some interesting details about Skirk that may hint at her role on the battlefield. According to the leak, she possesses a talent called Reason Beyond Reason, which summons a Void Rift when a nearby party member triggers one of the following Genshin Impact Elemental Reactions: Frozen, Superconduct, Cryo Swirl, or Crystallize. This effect can be triggered every 2.5 seconds, and up to three rifts can exist on the field at once. When Skirk hits an enemy with a Charged Attack while in a special stance, she absorbs these rifts to trigger an AoE attack. Each absorbed rift grants her eight stacks of an effect called Serpents Subtlety.

Genshin Impact: Skirk Talents, Element and Release Date Expectations

Another talent, Return to Oblivion, allows Skirk to gain a special effect called Deaths Crossing when a Hydro or Cryo party member deals Elemental Damage. Like the previous talent, Skirk can accumulate up to three stacks of Deaths Crossing, with the effect lasting for 18 seconds. During this time, her Normal Attacks and Elemental Burst receive a significant damage boost. The leak notes that this effect is only triggered when a Cryo party member, other than Skirk, deals Elemental Damage, strongly suggesting that she will be a new Cryo user in Genshin Impact .

Although Skirk has made only a few in-game appearances, the official storyline reveals she is tied to the Abyss. She is also said to be a disciple of Surtalogi, the master of the All-Devouring Narwhal. Skirk resides in a dark realm where time flows differently, and many fans suspect that she will be one of the key characters to introduce the Traveler to Genshin Impact 's Abyss.

At the moment, her main connection to the world of Teyvat appears to be her mentorship of Genshin Impact 's Tartaglia after he fell into the Abyss. As for her expected release date, with leaks steadily surfacing, it wouldnt be surprising if Skirk debuts in Genshin Impact Version 5.7.

Step into Teyvat, a vast world teeming with life and flowing with elemental energy.

You and your sibling arrived here from another world. Separated by an unknown god, stripped of your powers, and cast into a deep slumber, you now awake to a world very different from when you first arrived.

Thus begins your journey across Teyvat to seek answers from The Seven the gods of each element. Along the way, prepare to explore every inch of this wondrous world, join forces with a diverse range of characters, and unravel the countless mysteries that Teyvat holds...

item.title: Destiny 2: Sundered Doctrine Loot Table
item.description:
The Sundered Doctrine is one of the best dungeons in Destiny 2 for many reasons. The encounters have more raid-like mechanics that involve the game's lore, and there are quite a few secrets to find. This dungeon also has a rich loot pool with four Legendary weapons, all of which can get a damage perk in each column.

Here's a complete breakdown of Sundered Doctrine's loot pool in Destiny 2 , including every drop and how to get it.

Destiny 2: All Encounter Drops in Sundered Doctrine

Solve the Riddle (First Encounter)

Zoetic Lockset (Second Encounter)

Kerrev, the Erased (Third Encounter)

Weapons

  • Unworthy (Arc scout rifle)
  • Unloved (Strand hand cannon)
  • Unsworn (Strand trace rifle)

  • Unworthy (Arc scout rifle)
  • Unvoiced (Void shotgun)
  • Unsworn (Strand trace rifle)

  • Finality's Auger (Solar linear fusion rifle)
  • Unworthy (Arc scout rifle)
  • Unloved (Strand hand cannon)
  • Unsworn (Strand trace rifle)
  • Unvoiced (Void shotgun)

Armor

  • Helmet
  • Arms
  • Legs

  • Helmet
  • Arms
  • Legs

  • Helmet
  • Arms
  • Chest
  • Legs

Similarly to Vesper's Host, the class item is tied to the dungeon quest , The Drowning Labyrinth. Find the worms and secret chambers around the dungeon to open the final vault, where you can get a class item and learn more about what the Dread have been doing in this Pyramid.

Legendary weapons from the Sundered Doctrine have one of the best Origin Traits in the game---Subjugation . When attacking weak targets (like red bars), the shots explode. When attacking strong targets, they become exhausted and deal less damage. When attacking Guardians, it increases the weapon's flinch resistance. For PvE, Subjugation grants a budget version of Explosive Payload, allowing you to double-down, and in some cases, triple-down, on damage perks.

The Exotic from this dungeon is the Finality's Auger Solar linear fusion rifle. While it's not a meta-defining weapon, it has a unique mechanic that deploys an autonomous Resonance turret. You can then mark targets for the turret to shoot using an alternate firing mode.

All the Legendary weapons from the Sundered Doctrine are incredibly strong thanks to the Origin Trait. Unworthy is an Arc scout rifle that can roll Firefly with Rolling Storm, Paracausal Affinity, or Voltshot. Unloved is a Strand hand cannon that can also get double damage perks with Dragonfly and Paracausal Affinity. This dungeon has one of the best loot pools, especially for PvE, so farm it while you can.

How to Farm Sundered Doctrine in Destiny 2

Until a new dungeon comes out, you can farm Sundered Doctrine without any restrictions . The exception is the Finality's Auger, whose drop chance is limited to one per character per week . This means you have at most three attempts per week to get the Exotic. When Destiny 2 introduces another dungeon, Sundered Doctrine will join the rest of the dungeons in the weekly rotation.
